event.logging

Class PrintSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • event.logging.PrintSettings

  • public class PrintSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    The printer settings that are to be used for the print job.

    Java class for anonymous complex type.

    The following schema fragment specifies the expected content contained within this class. 

     <complexType>
   <complexContent>
     <restriction base="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}anyType">
       <sequence>
         <element name="PaperSize" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}string" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="Orientation" type="{event-logging:3}PrintSettingsOrientation" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="Colour" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}boolean" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="DeviceFonts" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}boolean" minOccurs="0"/>
         <element name="Data" type="{event-logging:3}Data" maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0"/>
       </sequence>
     </restriction>
   </complexContent>
 </complexType>

Most print jobs will not use device fonts so this defaults to false and can therefore be omitted if device fonts are not being used.  <P> Gets the value of the deviceFonts property.  @return possible object is {@link Boolean }")

      • isColour

        public java.lang.Boolean isColour()
        True if printing in colour. Most printing is performed in black and white so this defaults to false and can therefore be omitted if printing in black and white.

        Gets the value of the colour property.

        Returns:
        possible object is Boolean

      • setColour

        public void setColour(java.lang.Boolean value)
        True if printing in colour. Most printing is performed in black and white so this defaults to false and can therefore be omitted if printing in black and white.

        Sets the value of the colour property.

        Parameters:
        value - allowed object is Boolean

      • isDeviceFonts

        public java.lang.Boolean isDeviceFonts()
        True if fonts are to be used on the printing device. Using device fonts reduces the size of the print job as no font information needs to be supplied to the printer. However, using device fonts will result in different output on different printers. Most print jobs will not use device fonts so this defaults to false and can therefore be omitted if device fonts are not being used.

        Gets the value of the deviceFonts property.

        Returns:
        possible object is Boolean

      • setDeviceFonts

        public void setDeviceFonts(java.lang.Boolean value)
        True if fonts are to be used on the printing device. Using device fonts reduces the size of the print job as no font information needs to be supplied to the printer. However, using device fonts will result in different output on different printers. Most print jobs will not use device fonts so this defaults to false and can therefore be omitted if device fonts are not being used.

        Sets the value of the deviceFonts property.

        Parameters:
        value - allowed object is Boolean

      • getData

        public java.util.List<Data> getData()
        Any other event data that does not fit into a schema element but may be useful for the purpose of audit.

        Gets the value of the data property.

        This accessor method returns a reference to the live list, not a snapshot. Therefore any modification you make to the returned list will be present inside the JAXB object. This is why there is not a set method for the data property.

        For example, to add a new item, do as follows: 

            getData().add(newItem);

        Objects of the following type(s) are allowed in the list Data
